name: Starr Pass Golf Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located at the back of a new exclusive, country club community development on the west side of Tucson. Although a little bit distant from most tourist locations and downtown, it felt secluded and relaxing, away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
reviews.title: Oasis in the Desert

reviews.text: We purchased two nights at the Starr Pass Golf Suites for $74 per night on Hotwire. I think this was a good deal, considering that TripAdvisor gives an average price of $219 per night—granted, that’s probably for the larger rooms!
reviews.title: Quiet and Peaceful Desert Retreat

reviews.text: We stayed in Casita #39B, just a short drive (or walk) from the main clubhouse—this is their most basic suite setup, and perfect for what we needed.
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.liked: — clean, quiet and close to downtown Tucson
likes.disliked: — hearing my neighbor thru the door

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were two tempura-pedic double beds, tv, microwave, small refrigerator, closet, table and two chairs in the main room. The bathroom was spacious with a large mirror and long cabinet, perfect for setting out all of our toiletries. The bed linens seemed a bit dated, but were still in nice shape and comforftable. The window in the bedroom overlooked the mountains and the golf course. A small parking lot allowed us to park a few feet from our front door.
reviews.title: great location, quiet!

reviews.text: The staff was very accommodating, eager to give directions and recommendations. They even left a voicemail on our phone to welcome us to Tucson. The resort also includes a pool, tennis courts, and a restaurant, although we didn’t use any of these amenities on our stay.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

likes.disliked: — the coffee pot in the room

reviews.text: We stayed here a week before Christmas.
reviews.title: Beautiful location and exquisite condos

likes.liked: — Staff was friendly and a beautiful area

reviews.title: You can't go wrong. We just returned from a one week stay and had a great time.
reviews.text: Two bedroom unit. It has lots of room and beautiful living area, kitchen, and two large baths.

reviews.title: Wonderful views of desert surroundings while sipping on wine!
reviews.text: Easy to find from the airport and surrounding area.
Ladies at check-in were very nice and said if we needed "anything" just call this number. It was almost as if they were waiting....had a TV problem and they were there in minutes!!
reviews.title: Quiet Retreat

reviews.text: I asked what we had to do when we left, she said, "walk away and lock the door". Many of these unit have you wash dishes, remove sheets, etc.
reviews.title: Starr Pass Golf Suites - The BEST!

reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay. the golf course is really nice as well as the pool area and small health facility. One bonus is the free shuttle service to the nearby Marriott which is really beautiful. there are several restaurants at this resort and the Marriott. I would recommend this resort to both couples and families, especially golfers. One other recommendation: try to get a unit larger than a hotel room or studio because they're really small
reviews.title: play golf in the desert

likes.liked: — golf course and view from resort

reviews.text: We stayed here in a deal from our timeshare organization - a good deal. We had a 1-bed suite, locked off from a studio. The communicating door allowed a certain amount of noise from the neighbors - more of a problem for them than for us (the bedroom is separate and really quiet). The place was large, nicely decorated, in excellent condition, well equipped kitchen, laundry room, superb bed. We were very comfortable. The suites are set in groups of single storey cottages in a green, desert garden setting - very well thought out and maintained. The whole development includes a golf course, and is in the middle of a protected park so you have access to hiking and biking trails in the mountainous desert area - lots of saguaros! The staff was efficient, friendly and attentive. There are nice pool and an adequate gym. Both were in frequent use - they weren't just check-box items.
reviews.title: Comfort in a park setting

reviews.text: Tucson and its attractions was about 15 mins drive away.
reviews.title: Quiet and peaceful but rooms sub-par

reviews.text: I wish we'd stayed 2 more weeks!
reviews.title: Ugh!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 nights during a conference in 2006. The surroundings were lovely, the staff was friendly, and the golfing was fun (albeit pricey). The accommodations were showing their age, though, and everything felt like disrepair might set in at any moment. The in-room internet access didn't work and required a guy to come out no less than 3 times to try to get it working, which it never really did for a few minutes at a time even then. For a business trip, this was OK (except for the internet issues). For a vacation spot, though, I would like to see the suites renovated to lessen the rundown atmosphere.
reviews.title: Shell Resort doesn't measure up

reviews.text: We chose this property because we needed accommodations for 7 days for four adults and a baby. The two bedroom casita we reserved was spacious, quiet, and an excellent value for the room rate. The swimming pool and fitness center were uncrowded, nicely maintained, but nothing special. The resort grounds were attractive. Our casita lacked the Tempurpedic mattresses advertised on the website - instead our beds had cheap, noisy, spring mattresses. The three televisions were small and of mediocre quality. The maid service was excellent. We learned that rental guests have a lower status than condominium exchange guests in that door delivery of free newspapers was limited to the latter group - we were expected to purchase our newspapers at the front desk (a several minute stroll away). The crib we requested during the reservation process was not delivered to our casita until the second day of our stay. All in all our experience with this property was positive and we likely would return if the occasion arises.
reviews.title: Spacious Accommodations

likes.disliked: — Distance from restaurants and other attractions

reviews.text: Starr Pass is an "OK" place for a weekend stay.
reviews.title: It's OK.
Clean, comfortable, cool stay at Starr Pass Golf Suites
reviews.text: We are a family of 4 and we went down to Tucson to visit the University of Arizona.
Our place was a studio, 2 queen beds and a bathroom.
reviews.title: Fabulous Resort

likes.liked: — There was plenty of room for 6 in our suite. We didn't feel like we were right on top of each other.
likes.disliked: — The dryer took forever to dry.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very small for a family of 4. It has a refrig and a microwave,small coffee maker and thats it.
reviews.title: Back at Starr Pass

description: Starr Pass Golf Suites is a Southwest vacation jewel. At the heart of the resort is the celebrated Starr Pass Golf Course a 27-hole Arnold Palmer Signature Golf Facility. Its desert style layout and dramatic terrain challenges golfers of all skill levels. Starr Pass Golf Suites is also perfect for a family getaway, hiking, or those seeking to enjoy the culture and adventure of the old southwest. The magnificent views from your spacious casita include natural desert landscaping drenched in 350 days of sunshine per year. A 75-foot heated Olympic swimming pool, whirlpool and fitness center are just the beginnings of a full array of amenities. Come see all the Tucson foothills have to offer at this southwest getaway.
